comments.author: Sobachatina
comments.content: This post is spectacular. So poetic it brings a tear to the eye.

comments.author: Stefan
comments.content:
Um, yeah. "Poetic." Here's another baking tip: if you're running low on sugar, you can use the treacle from this post as a sweetener.

Recipe looks nice, though.

comments.author: sarah, simply cooked
comments.content: Ah, I'm with you, Sobachatina. A bit of sparkly nostalgia and wonder at life is good for us. Let's enjoy the beauty around us. The recipe sounds lovely.

comments.author: Katherine Martinelli
comments.content: I will likely be making this later this week, just love it! I love sour cream in desserts and the peaches are beautiful right now.

comments.author: Michelle
comments.content: I made this yesterday w/ plain ol' whole wheat flour and 2% milk (b/c that's what I had on hand) and it was delicious!  I'm keeping this recipe :-)

comments.author: Tres Delicious
comments.content: Such a luscious cream buckle. I will have this recipe over the next weekend.

comments.author: Sheila
comments.content:
Tried it with the "half dark brown sugar" sub -- absolutely wonderful! It was the hit of our brunch this morning. Our neighbor, a self-professed "no dessert guy," had three pieces.

Thanks!

comments.author: Laura
comments.content: Wait, is it baking powder or baking soda? The ingredients say one, the directions another. Help!

comments.author: Michael Natkin
comments.content: Baking powder! Thanks for pointing that out, I've fixed the directions now.

comments.author: Trea Coleman
comments.content: I made this yesterday with half light brown sugar since it's what I had. I also added some raspberries and it was wonderful. Maybe Michael stopped by today to tell you the same. :)

comments.author: Michael Natkin
comments.content: I didn't see your Michael today; glad to hear the buckle came out well!

comments.author: Terri
comments.content: I put up 11 quarts of sliced peaches today.  As soon as my hands recover I will be making this.
